body: Is it at all possible to get a `ls -ld "/storage/sdcard1/sync/Abaddon's gate/"`?

Also, is this new? I seem to recall chmod being accepted just fine by Android, but the semantics being that of FAT (i.e. we really only get 0777/0555 for dirs and 0666/0444 for files), while this seems to deny the chmod entirely...

issue.title: dst create chmod operation not permitted
issue.body:
Synchronization gets stuck at ~80 percent and android log is full of messages like these:

```
03-05 21:43:03.525 I/SyncthingNativeCode(32092): [6PY5D] 20:43:03 INFO: Puller (folder "telefon", file "Abaddon's gate/Abaddon's Gate (Unabridged) Part 1.m4a"): dst create chmod: chmod /storage/sdcard1/sync/Abaddon's gate/.syncthing.Abaddon's Gate (Unabridged) Part 1.m4a: operation not permitted
```

Ignore permissions setting is set on both android and remote node. I tried to delete everything and start from scratch. That worked for a while but same thing happened again.

I am using version 0.5.17 on android and v0.10.24 on the other linux node.

Thank you for any tips.

body:
Here is the requested ls.

```
shell@dogo:/ $ ls -la /storage/sdcard1/sync/Abaddon\'s\ gate/                  
-rwxrwx--- root     sdcard_r 50855936 2015-03-05 21:20 .syncthing.Abaddon's Gate (Unabridged) Part 1.m4a
-rwxrwx--- root     sdcard_r 91247538 2015-03-05 21:23 Abaddon's Gate (Unabridged) Part 2.m4a
-rwxrwx--- root     sdcard_r 87431269 2015-03-05 21:23 Abaddon's Gate (Unabridged) Part 3.m4a
shell@dogo:/ $ ls -ld /storage/sdcard1/sync/Abaddon\'s\ gate/                  
drwxrwx--- root     sdcard_r          2015-03-05 21:23 
shell@dogo:/ $
```

I am not sure what you mean by "is this new?" :( The device runs Cyanogenmod 11 (Android 4.4.4)

Also I do not think it is a system problem because the two other files in same folder synced just fine.

It's also possible to get into problems when using ACL permissions:

```
touch myfile
sudo chown root:root myfile
sudo setfacl -m u:user:rwx,g:user:rwx,o::r-x myfile
echo "TEST" >> myfile # Works
chmod 666 myfile
$ chmod: changing permissions of ‘myfile’: Operation not permitted
```
And this works on android? In either case I have done no such thing.
Right, I know when/why this happens now. Thanks!

issue.title: Errors encountered during chmod operation causes runaway retry loop

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
As reported on the forms, [here](https://forum.syncthing.net/t/syncthing-never-syncs-on-freenas-with-100-cpu-usage/8901), and in ticket #2727, certain configurations of ACL on FreeBSD/FreeNAS will cause a chmod to fail during file sync.  When this happens, errors like these are seen on the console:

`Puller (folder "xxxxx-xxxxx", file "Photo/IMAG0594.jpg"): dst create chmod: chmod /mnt/Documents/user/Desktop/Photo/.syncthing.IMAG0594.jpg.tmp: operation not permitted`

These errors are repeated over and over for all affected files, during which processor utilization is observed to be 100% of a single core.

The sync state in the webGUI will appear to be stuck at whatever proportion of the dataset is affected.  In my case this was 0%.  On the NAS, all files were in place, however they were all renamed to .syncthing.*.tmp.

This issue popped up in the past as #1404.  At that time, a workaround was added to use "Ignore permissions".  That workaround does work to alleviate the ACL issue.

However, syncthing should abort the sync and report an error message to the user when it fails the chmod, similar to how it acts with other permissions issues (populating the "Failed Items" field and reporting the "operation not permitted" on each file).  It should not go into a runaway retry loop.
